channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Christmas in Brisbane
item.description:
Sunday, December 31, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red and Green to support Christmas in Brisbane.

Brisbane comes alive this December with plenty of Christmas festivities ideal for the whole family. Join us for the Lighting of the Christmas Tree, sing along to your favourite Christmas tunes at the Lord Mayor's Christmas Carols or drop by Queen Street in the Brisbane CBD for pop-up entertainment and roaming performances. For more information about Christmas in the heart of Brisbane, visit the Visit Brisbane website.

Find out what Brisbane has on offer this festive season.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description: The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red and Green to support Christmas in Brisbane. item.title: Christmas in Brisbane
item.description:
Sunday, December 31, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in Brisbane.

The City will host an exciting Christmas program in 2023, bringing the spirit of Christmas to the locals and visitors during December.

Get ready to be captivated by the magical charm of Christmas at The Lott by Golden Casket City Hall Lights. Brisbane's iconic City Hall will transform into a lively canvas of stunning visuals and sounds of a Christmas story. The free show occurs every 15 minutes from 7.30pm to midnight daily from the 8th to the 24th of December.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in Brisbane.

item.title: Brisbane Heat New Year's Bash - Brisbane Heat vs Sydney Sixers
item.description:
Monday, January 1, 2024

The Reddacliffe Place sculpures will be lit Teal to celebrate Brisbane Heat New Year's Bash - Brisbane Heat vs Sydney Sixers.

Start the year off with a bang at the Big Bash. The New Year's Day match is guarantee to deliver big hits, high energy and electrifying entertainment when the Brisbane Heat play the Sydney Sixers.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Brisbane International
item.description:
Sunday, January 7, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Blue to celebrate the Brisbane International.

We are delighted to welcome the Brisbane International back, bigger and better than ever in 2024!
Running from December 31 to January 7 with Nine Grand Slam champions, this year’s Brisbane International presented by Evie is one of the strongest fields the tournament has ever seen.

Fans can look forward to eight days of high-quality international tennis, an expanded women’s draw, and 180 of the world’s best players competing for a big prize pool.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency



Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

Running from December 31 to January 7 with Nine Grand Slam champions, this year’s Brisbane International presented by Evie is one of the strongest fields the tournament has ever seen. Fans can look forward to eight days of high-quality international tennis, an expanded women’s draw, and 180 of the world’s best players competing for a big prize pool. This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description: City Hall will be lit Blue to celebrate the Brisbane International. We are delighted to welcome the Brisbane International back, bigger and better than ever in 2024! Running from December 31 to January 7 with Nine Grand Slam champions, this year’s Brisbane International presented by Evie is one of the strongest fields the tournament has ever seen. Fans can look forward to eight days of high-quality international tennis, an expanded women’s draw, and 180 of the world’s best players competing for a big prize pool. This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: National Corrections Day
item.description:
Friday, January 19, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue and White to support National Corrections Day.

Queensland Corrective Services (QCS) assists crime prevention through the humane containment, supervision and rehabilitation of prisoners and offenders in correctional centres and the community. National Corrections Day is a day to appreciate and celebrate the work of corrections officers on the front line of public safety the length and breadth of Queensland and across the nation.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Corrective Services

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
